title: Five NBA games, three NFL games, one loaded Christmas Day slate: Everything you need to know
content: Christmas Day includes three NFL matchups and five NBA games. We're previewing them all with picks, predictions, storylines and more.

title: Kerr settles Draymond beef: 'Not my finest hour'
content: In a remarkable 15-minute media session Wednesday, Golden State Warriors coach Steve Kerr took responsibility for his argument with Draymond Green that caused the forward to leave the bench in the middle of a game.

title: Cards' Sweat irked by 'frustrating' Pro Bowl snub
content: Cardinals edge rusher Josh Sweat did not hold back his disappointment Wednesday in being named a Pro Bowl alternate this week.

title: Vikes' Kelly to IR after 3rd concussion of season
content: The Vikings placed center Ryan Kelly on injured reserve Wednesday, ending his season and possibly his career after he suffered his third concussion of the year.

title: WR Rice among four Chiefs players placed on IR
content: Chiefs wide receiver Rashee Rice's 2025 season began with a suspension and now will end on injured reserve.

title: Harbaugh denies rift, on 'A-plus' terms with Lamar
content: Responding to a column in The Baltimore Sun, Ravens coach John Harbaugh insisted on Wednesday that his relationship with quarterback Lamar Jackson is "A-plus."

title: T.J. Watt practices for 1st time since lung injury
content: The Steelers' T.J. Watt, two weeks removed from sustaining a partially punctured lung during a dry needling treatment and having subsequent reparative surgery, returned to practice for the first time Wednesday.

title: Commanders to start QB Johnson vs. Cowboys
content: The Commanders will start 39-year-old Josh Johnson at quarterback for their Christmas Day home game against the Cowboys, coach Dan Quinn announced Wednesday.

title: 'That's what we sign up for': Five tales -- and a few gripes -- from playing on Christmas
content: With NBA Christmas games on the horizon, stars and coaches share their stories and gripes about playing on the holiday.

title: 'Mr. Eligible': The growing fraternity of NFL sixth offensive linemen
content: NFL teams are using sixth O-linemen in more plays this season, and we're highlighting, yep -- six of them.

title: Bah humbug: An NFL holiday story, featuring festive names from around the league
content: From Jaylin Noel to Julius Chestnut, the fictional Holiday Bowl is full of holiday cheer as told by Rich Cimini.

title: NFL Week 17 buzz: What we're hearing on Joe Burrow, the red-hot Jaguars and Pro Bowl rosters
content: Here's the latest, including intel on Burrow's future, opening QB1 spots, the Jaguars' legitimacy and Pro Bowl roster fallout.

title: NFL execs on how Tua Tagovailoa lost his edge and Mike McDaniel's support
content: What has gone wrong for Tagovailoa, what's the Dolphins' path forward and is there any interest in him?

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: The 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, ranked!
content: Here are the 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, as ranked by an expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists.

title: This will be the Premier League's quietest Boxing Day ever: Where did all the games go?
content: The day after Christmas is usually jam-packed with great Premier League matchups, but not this year. What gives?

title: NBA Power Rankings: Young risers to watch on all 30 teams
content: From ROY and MIP races, our NBA insiders break down all 30 teams' young riser in this week's Power Rankings.

title: Vikings' 'Winter Warrior' look leads NFL Week 17 uniforms
content: The holiday week means uniform heat all around the NFL in Week 17, led by a monochromatic look from the Minnesota Vikings.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Christmas Day and all of Week 17
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: How a random NFL drug test led to a cancer diagnosis: Alex Singleton's 'horrifying' past two months
content: The Broncos linebacker discovered he had testicular cancer from a league drug test. And now he plays the game with a fresh perspective.

title: A miracle child, a priceless penny and a racing legend
content: Back in 1998, long before the United States stopped producing the penny, a little girl with spina bifida gave Dale Earnhardt a gift that raises the question: What if pennies are actually worth everything?

title: Bracketology: UConn supplants Duke as fourth No. 1 seed
content: The Huskies return to the top line as Duke drops to a 2-seed after suffering its first loss of the season.

title: Power Rankings: Should UConn or Texas be No. 1?
content: Texas has the best two-way point guard in the game. UConn might have the two best players in the nation.

title: Bracketology: Louisville up, Tennessee down as host battle heats up
content: A decisive win over Tennessee put Louisville solidly inside the top 16 -- and dropped the Lady Vols to a 6-seed.

title: Why and when the WNBPA executive committee might vote to strike
content: How and when would the WNBPA executive committee vote to strike? What would that entail? What benefits would be lost?

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: A 12-player blockbuster? Cy Young signings? Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the baseball offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Aggrieved fan index: The 10 fan bases in 2025 that have the right to be most frustrated
content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

title: Best bets, DFS plays for the Christmas Day tripleheader: Edge to the road teams
content: Betting the Christmas Day games? Here are the odds, game picks, prop plays and daily fantasy tips for all three.

title: NBA betting: Two ways to get more value betting on the Thunder this season
content: Andre Snellings looks at the creative ways to bet the NBA's best team this season and still get value.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Murillo, Aké in defensive push
content: Barcelona want Nottingham Forest defender Murillo or Manchester City's Nathan Aké on loan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Missed bus, narrow escape: Survivors describe panic, delays in services after bus caught fire
content: A survivor recounts desperate moments as he escaped out of the burning vehicle: ‘I jumped down, broke the window, and managed to pull another passenger out. Within 40 seconds, everything was burning. Nothing was visible. Thick smoke engulfed the bus, and we could not make out if people were still inside or even where to run.’

title: Neither people of Vizag nor their representatives consulted on Rushikonda buildings, says BJP MLA
content: Objecting to the Cabinet Sub-Committee’s plan to recommend the handing over of the buildings to major hotel groups, Vishnu Kumar Raju says the opinion of the people of Visakhapatnam must be taken into consideration

title: Rebellion growing in Upendra Kushwaha’s party in Bihar, two more MLAs maintain distance, 8 office-bearers resign
content: Dinara MLA Alok Kumar Singh and Madhubani MLA Madhaw Anand, along with Mr. Mahto, skip the dinner party organised by party president in Patna

title: Indian Army allows ‘passive participation’ on social media, revises long-standing ban
content: Revised guidelines permit viewing access on select platforms while retaining strict controls to safeguard operational security

title: People enjoying fruits of reforms initiated by former Prime Minister A.B. Vajpayee, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The reforms have become the central pillar of India’s development, he says, and defends development of medical colleges under PPP model

title: Ban on women using smartphones in Rajasthan withdrawn; elders say prohibition kept children in mind
content: The ban was imposed following the suggestions that women should not use smartphones, a Chaudhary community member said, adding that no one was bound to follow the decision.

title: Rajasthan considering reintroduction of educational criteria for panchayat, local body polls
content: The provision for compulsory education for candidates was introduced in the State in 2015 during the tenure of the then Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje; the Congress had strongly opposed the move

title: Proposed AHINDA convention may add to leadership tussle
content: Meet threatens to open up another front between Siddaramaiah and  Shivakumar; Jarkiholi says they need not require anyone’s certificate to hold the event

title: Govt. links intel grid to National Population Register, agencies can access details of 119 crore residents
content: The Home Ministry has been advocating the use of NATGRID by State police and Central agencies to collect intelligence and speed up investigation of criminal cases

title: Congress calls for State-level consultation on December 29 against ‘black law’ on rural employment
content: New legislation weakens the MGNREGA and threatens the livelihood of the rural poor, it says, calling upon people to expose BJP’s ‘feudal policies’

title: Ensure transparency in urea distribution, build farmers’ confidence, says official
content: Special Chief Secretary of Agriculture and Cooperation Department reviews issues concerning urea supply and the procurement of pulses such as red gram and black gram by MARKFED, among others

title: CPI(M) and Congress wrangle over photographs of Sabarimala gold theft case accused with Sonia Gandhi
content: The CPI(M) has weaponised the photographs in the wake of the civic polls, which saw the UDF riding to victory on an emotive campaign powered by provocative parodies implicating the Left Democratic Front (LDF) government in the Sabarimala gold theft

title: Govt. allows inclusion of quartzite in limestone mining lease held by Ramco in Nandyal district
content: The government has fixed the seigniorage fee at ₹160 per MT for industrial use, according to G.O. Ms. No. 261

title: RSS chief  Mohan Bhagwat stresses importance of ‘gopuja’
content: He visits the ‘Saptha Gopradakshinasala’, the facility built by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams at Alipiri

title: Unrest over NoC to Vedanta for drilling oil wells in Krishna district
content: Villagers and HRF question the G.O. permitting the company to drill wells at 20 locations of Kaza Block in Movva and Guduru mandals of the district; government has issued the NoC after taking into consideration all aspects, and if there is any violation, action will be taken as per law, asserts district Collector Balaji

title: Life comes full circle for tsunami survivor Meghana
content: From enduring tsunami, Meghana takes to freediving in the same sea, which once threatened to consume her

title: Will hold general council meeting as planned: G.K. Mani
content: He alleges that the faction led by Anbumani Ramadoss is resorting to drama and terms it as a move to divert public attention in order to hold alliance talks for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Delhi air quality improves as AQI drops to 234; deterioration likely in coming days
content: Transport emissions and pollution from neighbouring cities continued to contribute significantly to the capital's air pollution load, according to official data

title: V. Muraleedharan questions legality of Kerala Cabinet's nativity card decision
content: The former Union Minister V. Muraleedharan said the authority to determine citizenship rests with the central government

title: Chandrababu Naidu breaching bail conditions, alleges YSRCP leader
content: The Chief Minister is misusing institutional powers to close cases registered against him, alleges YSRCP leader and former AAG Ponnavolu Sudhakar Reddy, while warning of approaching the Supreme Court on the issue

title: Leverage potential of PPP model to strengthen healthcare infrastructure, says Union Health Minister J.P. Nadda
content: In a letter addressed to State Health Minister Satya Kumar, he says the Centre is offering substantial financial support under Viability Gap Funding scheme for the PPP projects, under which up to 60% of the cost is borne equally between the Union and State governments

title: ‘Neuro Justice Trilogy’ proposes function-based approach to disability assessment in accident cases
content: ‘The idea of ‘Neuro Justice’ emerged from years of treating trauma patients who survived injuries but struggled to secure fair compensation because the functional impact of brain injuries was poorly understood in legal settings’

title: Kerala Lok Bhavan's December 25 event draws flak from Labour Minister Sivankutty
content: The Minister made the remarks after Lok Bhavan observed Good Governance Day on December 25 to mark the birth anniversary of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Chief Minister Stalin to inaugurate 280 free houses for Sri Lankan Tamils in Tiruvannamalai on December 27
content: The houses have been built at a cost of 22.62 crore for Sri Lankan Tamils living in rehabilitation camps at Kasthambadi village near Polur town

title: Congress holding discussions to form alliance with VBA for Maharashtra civic polls: Harshwardhan Sapkal
content: Discussions are also underway with the Shiv Sena (UBT) led by Uddhav Thackeray, a constituent of the Maha Vikas Aghadi and INDI bloc

title: BJP names V.V. Rajesh as Thiruvananthapuram mayoral candidate after historic win
content: The BJP secured control of the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation with 50 seats, breaking a Left stronghold that had lasted for four decades. The Congress-led UDF also made significant gains by doubling its seat tally

title: Sand lorry owners’ federation raises concern over poor quality of M-sand in T.N.
content: The Federation noted there are about 4,000 M-sand manufacturing units in the State. Of this, only 478 M-sand manufacturing units were approved for quality by the Public Works Department

title: Forest Department and outsourced personnel get insurance coverage in Karnataka
content: Environment Minister Eshwar Khandre said the frontline Forest Department staff work day and night, facing dangers while protecting forests and wildlife, and the department has lost several brave green warriors

title: PM inaugurates Rashtra Prerna Sthal in Lucknow, says ‘BJP proud our govt. had opportunity to tear down wall of Article 370’
content: The Rashtra Prerna Sthal in Lucknow was inaugurated on the 101st birth anniversary of former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee

title: Christmas celebrated with fervour, spirit of goodwill in Kittur Karnataka region
content: The Christian community attended Christmas mass at various churches and prayer halls across various towns and cities of Kittur Karnataka region on December 25

title: TDP chief flays YSRCP’s ‘culture of intimidation’
content: Palla Srinivasa Rao reacts to reports of YSRCP supporters allegedly taking out processions while wielding sharp weapons, including hunting sickles, on the occasion of former Chief Minister Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy’s birthday

title: Karnataka bus accident: MLA B. P. Yatnal wants government to conduct safety audit of all buses
content: If any bus is found violating safety protocols, their licence should be cancelled and their owners should be jailed, says MLA

title: Watch: Tamil Nadu’s 2025: The missing millions, the sacred hill and the race for 2026 | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: In this episode of Focus Tamil Nadu, we look back at a year that reshaped the State’s political landscape. From a massive voter list purge and a deadly stampede to a legal battle over a sacred hill, 2025 raised urgent questions on democracy and communal harmony. Delimitation fears and fierce alliance battles further defined this pivotal year.

title: NCB arrests five individuals at Duvvada, seizes 4 kg hashish oil
content: Any information related to narcotics can be shared through MANAS – National Narcotics Helpline Toll-Free Number: 1933; the identity of informers is strictly kept confidential

title: Tribal students’ scholarships released, says Minister Sandhya Rani
content: For the 2025–26 academic year, the release of funds to eligible students is currently underway. So far, ₹100.93 crore has been disbursed, benefiting 59,297 students, the Minister says

title: AP Government modifies survey numbers in Amaravati land allotments
content: The government approved modifications to specific survey numbers while making it clear that all other aspects of the original allotments, including land extent and conditions, remain unchanged

title: Proposal for Greater Vijayawada Municipal Corporation gets positive response from CM Naidu
content: Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath (Chinni) said the merger of around 75 surrounding villages into the proposed GVMC would significantly boost industrial corridors, IT parks,  tourism investments

title: Migrant worker from Bengal dies after being attacked by locals in Odisha
content: The contractor said local miscreants asked for Aadhaar proof from the workers to prove their nationality and launched sudden attack

title: AP government to supply medicines to hospitals in tribal regions using drones
content: The initiative will be operated with Paderu in Alluri Sitarama Raju district as the central hub, with services scheduled to begin by the end of next month

title: 2017 actress assault case: Convicted man moves Kerala HC against verdict
content: Weeks after a Kerala court acquitted Malayalam cinema actor Dileep in the sensational case and convicted six others, the convict, identified as Martin, has sought the setting aside of his conviction and sentence

title: Nurse stabbed to death by father, brother in Madurai over opposition to her relationship
content: She was stabbed in Avaniyapuram on December 20 and was subsequently admitted to the Government Rajaji Hospital with multiple stab injuries to the throat and shoulders. She later succumbed to her injuries on December 22, 2025

title: Karnataka bus accident: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy attributes fire to truck hitting bus near fuel tank
content: As many as five persons died after a container truck hit a sleeper bus on National Highway 48 near Hiriyur in Chitradurga district early on December 25

title: Journalist found dead in her house in Mizoram
content: Ezrela Dalidia Fanai, 41, was a freelance journalist who had worked with several national media houses over the years. She lived alone in the house after her mother passed away in July, police said

title: Bangladesh unrest: Another Hindu man lynched; cops link it to extortion bid
content: Bangladesh faces renewed criticism after a second lynching, this time of Amrit Mondal, just days after worker Dipu Chandra Das was killed. Mondal was allegedly beaten to death by villagers after demanding extortion money. These incidents highlight growing concerns over the safety of minority communities amidst ongoing unrest.

title: 'Ready to enhance trust with India': China slams explosive US report; evasive on Pak ties
content: China has strongly refuted a US Pentagon report alleging it's using eased border tensions with India to undermine US-India ties. Beijing insists its defence policy is misrepresented and aims to sow discord. China maintains its border situation with India is stable and seeks to advance a sound bilateral relationship, while dismissing US claims as biased and confrontational.

title: VHT: '​​Not an ideal contest' - Sooryavanshi's knock raises concerns in Ashwin's mind
content: R Ashwin questioned the growing quality gap in Indian domestic cricket after Bihar smashed a record 574 runs against Arunachal Pradesh in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. While praising Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, Ashwin said such one-sided matches hurt competition and confidence. He also lauded Ishan Kishan’s comeback, highlighting how hard work and form revived his career.

title: xAI is hiring: Musk's 2-word response to top company exec
content: Elon Musk's xAI is aggressively recruiting seasoned Android engineers, promising exceptional pay and unparalleled career growth.  The company seeks developers with over a decade of experience in Kotlin and modern Android practices to build applications for X and Grok.  This high-stakes hiring drive underscores xAI's ambition to attract top talent in the competitive AI landscape.

title: 'Decorative piece': After India slams razing of Hindu statue, Thailand offers explanation
content: Thailand defended demolishing a Vishnu statue near the Cambodian border, citing security and administration. India expressed strong disapproval, calling the act disrespectful to Hindu sentiments. Cambodia confirmed the statue was on its territory and condemned the destruction, amidst ongoing border clashes that have claimed numerous lives

title: 2025 Box Office report card: From 'Dhurandhar' to 'Saiyaara'- key learnings to take
content: 2025's box office proved a mixed bag, with strong content driving audiences despite fewer mega-hits. Trade experts highlight a 'K-shaped' model where successful films soar, while others falter quickly. Standout performers like 'Dhurandhar' and 'Chhaava' delivered massive returns, signaling content's enduring power and a modest 10-12% box office growth over 2024.

title: Revised railway fares from Dec 26: Ministry notifies 'rationalised' structure; what changes
content: Indian Railways has announced a fare "rationalisation" effective December 26, aiming for affordability and operational sustainability. Suburban services and season tickets remain unchanged. Short-distance ordinary journeys up to 215 km are also unaffected. Mail/Express and AC/Non-AC ordinary services will see modest increases, with specific graded hikes for non-suburban ordinary journeys.

title: Telegram founder’s plan: Durov pledges equal shares to DNA-verified kids
content: Telegram founder Pavel Durov offered to fund IVF treatments using his donated sperm, promising an equal share of his $17 billion fortune to any children who can prove their DNA connection. Having fathered over 100 children globally, Durov stated his donations aimed to address a worldwide sperm shortage. He plans to open-source his DNA to help his offspring connect.

title: 'Houses of 7 Hindu families burnt': Arson attacks spike in B'desh; family narrates horror
content: At least seven Hindu families in Bangladesh have had their homes burnt down in targeted attacks over the past five days amidst national turmoil.  One family narrowly escaped a fire by cutting through their walls, with police arresting five suspects and vowing to track down others. These incidents follow two recent lynchings of minority members, sparking outrage over safety concerns.

title: Capital chokes: Delhi's AQI 'improves' to poor; relief temporary
content: Delhi's air quality saw a welcome improvement for the second day, moving from 'severe' to 'poor' levels. While some areas experienced 'moderate' air, others remained in 'poor' or 'very poor' categories. Vehicular emissions and neighbouring NCR districts were identified as major pollution sources. Forecasts suggest a potential return to 'very poor' conditions soon.

title: 'Hurt Hindu sentiments': Bajrang Dal stages protest outside Bareilly church; watch
content: Right-wing groups Bajrang Dal and Vishwa Hindu Parishad protested outside a Bareilly church on Christmas Eve, alleging objectionable portrayals of Hinduism.  Reciting the Hanuman Chalisa, they claimed Christmas events hurt Hindu sentiments. Police are investigating after the groups submitted a memorandum demanding action against alleged misleading depictions of religious conversion and Hindu society.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
content: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: 'I've a plan': Zia's son rolls through Dhaka in bulletproof bus; what he said about Hindus
content: Tarique Rahman, BNP's acting chairman, made a dramatic return to Bangladesh after 17 years in exile, stepping into a nation facing turmoil. He drew parallels between current political upheaval and the 1971 liberation struggle, declaring "I have a plan" for the country's future. His arrival is expected to significantly influence Bangladesh's internal politics and its relationship with India.

title: GRAP 4 lifted: Delhi schools resume normal classes for 6-9 & 11; hybrid for rest
content: Delhi schools have ended hybrid learning and resumed normal physical classes for students of Classes 6 to 9 and 11 after GRAP 4 measures were lifted. The Directorate of Education issued directions to government and private schools to implement the change immediately. The decision followed an improvement in air quality, with authorities continuing GRAP stages 1 to 3 while monitoring conditions closely across the capital.

title: Watch: Hardik ignores abusive fan; wins hearts during dinner date
content: Hardik Pandya stayed calm after a fan hurled abuse while he was leaving a restaurant with girlfriend Maheika Sharma following a Christmas dinner. The video went viral, drawing praise for his restraint. On the field, Pandya starred in India’s T20I series win over South Africa with explosive knocks, including a 16-ball fifty.

title: In classrooms, emotional strain is outpacing academic questions: Reality teachers can't ignore
content: Teachers are increasingly hearing anxiety and emotional fatigue instead of academic doubts in classrooms. The Student Sync Index 2026 reveals that student stress is constant, with mental health concerns now outweighing academic pressure. While teachers recognise this shift and respond with empathy, the roots of stress are often externalised, leaving school systems largely unchanged.

title: Odisha encounter: Top Maoist with Rs 1.2 crore bounty among 4 killed; arms seized
content: A significant blow to the Maoist insurgency occurred in Odisha's Kandhamal district as central committee member Ganesh Uike, with a Rs 1.2 crore bounty, was killed in an encounter. Security forces gunned down Uike and three associates in a forest, recovering weapons and ammunition.

title: Is Jalen Brunson playing tonight vs Cavaliers? Latest Knicks injury update
content: Jalen Brunson has been cleared to play on Christmas Day against the Cleveland Cavaliers after managing an ankle issue. His availability is crucial for the Knicks' primary scorer and decision-maker in this closely watched Eastern Conference matchup. Brunson's strong December performance, including a 47-point game, makes his presence a significant factor.

title: 'Didn't want to miss ...': How B'luru techie plotted wife's murder; chilling details emerge
content: A 39-year-old bank manager was allegedly murdered by her estranged software engineer husband, Balamurugan, who had planned the killing for months. He reportedly procured an illegal pistol and carried a knife as a backup, later surrendering to police and showing no remorse. The couple had a troubled marriage marked by alleged abuse.

title: 'Don't comment, post views': Army issues policy on use of social media apps
content: The Army has unveiled new social media guidelines for its personnel. While platforms like Instagram and YouTube are restricted to viewing and information gathering, users can share unclassified general information on messaging apps like WhatsApp and Signal with known contacts. LinkedIn is permitted for professional networking and job seeking purposes only.

title: IndiGo cancels 67 flights; bad weather, operational reasons cited
content: IndiGo is dealing with another wave of disruptions, canceling 67 flights due to weather and operational issues, impacting key airports. This comes as the airline operates under DGCA scrutiny following earlier mass cancellations linked to new pilot rest rules. The aviation regulator's panel is investigating, with a report on IndiGo's operational woes expected soon.

title: Jason Kelce admits fame is disrupting family life with Kylie and their kids
content: Jason Kelce opens up about how rising fame after retirement is affecting everyday life with wife Kylie Kelce and their four children. The former Eagles center explains why public outings feel different now, how visibility has increased beyond football, and where he draws firm boundaries between family life, media work, and the spotlight surrounding Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift.

title: VHT: Rohit stops young fan from touching his feet; video goes viral
content: Rohit Sharma won hearts after stopping a young fan from touching his feet following Mumbai’s Vijay Hazare Trophy opener. He then starred with the bat, smashing 155 off 94 balls as Mumbai beat Sikkim by eight wickets in Jaipur. Rohit’s knock included his fastest-ever List A century and ensured a dominant win.

title: H-1B in age of social media vetting: When tweets meet immigration rules for global talent
content: America’s H-1B visa process has picked up a new gatekeeper: your social media. A December 2025 State Department update asks H-1B applicants and H-4 dependants to keep their accounts public during visa processing, widening a review earlier used for student visas. For skilled workers, the shift is subtle but real—credentials still matter, but so does your digital footprint, and how it might be read.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury update: 31-yr-old has 1st batting session since injury
content: India's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has begun batting practice sessions post-injury in Mumbai, showing no discomfort. The 31-year-old is now heading to the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru for further assessment. While a return date remains uncertain, Iyer is aiming for the Vijay Hazare Trophy, with clarity expected after assessment at the CoE.

title: MDMA, LSD, ecstasy pills: Woman techie & boyfriend held for selling high-end drugs
content: Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested four individuals, including three alleged drug peddlers, in a drug network bust. Officials seized a significant quantity of drugs, including OG, MDMA, LSD blots, and ecstasy pills, valued at over Rs 3 lakh. The operation revealed a sophisticated network involving online procurement and cryptocurrency payments.

title: 'You don’t know me yet': Killers’ chilling words before shooting Aligarh teacher; how events unfolded
content: A 45-year-old computer teacher, Rau Danish Ali, was fatally shot by two masked assailants on a two-wheeler while taking an evening walk on the AMU campus. The attackers fled the scene after firing at close range. Police are investigating the incident, with the family suggesting the victim may have known his attackers.

title: CBSE in 2025: A look back at the changes set to reshape board exams
content: CBSE will introduce wide-ranging reforms from the 2025–26 session, reshaping exams, curriculum, and student support. Class 10 board exams will become biannual from 2026, allowing score improvement. APAAR ID linkage is now mandatory for Classes 9–12. Exam fees have increased, while syllabi align with NCF 2023. New career guidance, mental health counselling models, and an AI-powered digital experience centre aim to reduce stress and modernise learning for students, parents, and schools nationwide and abroad too.

title: Karisma Kapoor, Sunjay Kapur’s kids wear late father’s jersey on Christmas
content: Karisma Kapoor's children, Samaira and Kiaan, honored their late father, industrialist Sunjay Kapur, on their first Christmas without him by wearing jerseys from his Aureus Polo team. This poignant gesture follows the Delhi High Court concluding proceedings in a Rs 30,000 crore estate dispute involving Sunjay's will and his widowed wife, Priya Sachdev.

title: Political scorecard in 2025: Top 10 winners and losers of this year
content: 2025 saw political shifts with Nitish Kumar retaining power in Bihar and Siddaramaiah navigating a leadership tussle. While Nitin Nabin and Chirag Paswan rose, the Congress faced defeats and internal strife. Arvind Kejriwal's AAP lost Delhi, and Prashant Kishor's political venture faltered, highlighting power's dynamic nature.

title: 'Sir, we have to evacuate ... ': Gadkari recalls meeting Hamas leader before killing; what followed next
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari recounted meeting Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh hours before his assassination in Tehran. Gadkari, was in Iran, attending presidential swearing-in, and was informed of Haniyeh's death early next morning. The incident highlighted the growing role of technology in modern conflict and national security.

title: Ashes 'drinking' row: 'I did exactly the same' — former captain defends England players
content: England's Ashes tour faces off-field controversy after a mid-series break. Former captain Michael Vaughan urges restraint, stating the issue stems from cricket's ingrained drinking culture. He argues that players relaxing on days off often engage in similar behaviour. Vaughan believes this is a systemic problem across several cricketing nations, not an individual failing.

title: Rich Indians rush to transfer money abroad as rupee falls, banks expand regulations
content: Indian banks are intensifying scrutiny on overseas money transfers, demanding detailed proof of fund origins from individuals and businesses. This heightened caution, particularly for remittances from NRO accounts, arises amid the rupee's slide and increased customer urgency to move funds abroad, leading to compliance hurdles.

title: 'Chanukah' sign car set ablaze in Melbourne days after Bondi beach shooting
content: A car adorned with a "Happy Chanukah" sign was deliberately set ablaze in Melbourne, prompting an investigation into a potential antisemitic attack. While no injuries were reported, the incident has heightened fears within the Jewish community, following a recent mass shooting at a Hanukkah festival.

title: Candidates 2026: 'Praggnanandhaa is third favourite' - World No. 1 Carlsen
content: World No. 1 and five-time World Champion Magnus Carlsen has named Americans Hikaru Nakamura and Fabiano Caruana as favourites for the 2026 Candidates, with India’s R Praggnanandhaa as the third contender. Praggnanandhaa is the only Indian among eight players competing to challenge World Champion D Gukesh. The tournament starts on March 28 in Cyprus.

title: B'day outing turns nightmare: IT manager 'gang raped' in CEO’s car; survivor recall horror
content: A private IT company manager alleged gang-rape by her CEO and an executive's husband in a moving car after a company party. The survivor claims she was drugged and molested by the CEO and raped by the executive's husband while the executive head was present. All three accused have been detained for questioning.

title: VHT: 'I get fans' frustration, but…' - Ashwin explains why matches weren't televised
content: Fans' frustration over limited Vijay Hazare Trophy TV coverage is understandable, says Ravichandran Ashwin.  While stars like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are lighting up the tournament with centuries, many matches remain unwatched. Ashwin explained that broadcasting schedules are set far in advance, making last-minute telecasts difficult despite the players' presence.

title: Fast food at train stations? Haldiram, WoW Momos & more plan setup at platforms
content: Fast-food giants like McDonald's and KFC are set to open outlets at Indian railway stations, with the first expected in 2026. This move aims to elevate passenger experience to airport standards, offering significant sales potential. Brands will secure five-year licenses through e-auctions, potentially boosting Indian Railways' non-fare revenue.

title: Dhurandhar box office: Ranveer Singh film crosses Rs 600 crore mark
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, crossing Rs 600 crore despite competition from 'Avatar Fire And Ash'. Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' faces a slow start with limited shows and dull advance bookings, indicating a challenging opening.

title: Who is Sebastian Telfair? Ex-NBA guard freed after prison stint with Diddy
content: Sebastian Telfair was released from federal prison after serving time for a probation violation linked to the NBA health care fraud case. The former Thunder guard served his sentence at Fort Dix, the same prison housing Sean “Diddy” Combs. Telfair spoke about Combs’ mindset behind bars and is now shifting focus toward a return to basketball through Ice Cube’s Big3 league.

title: No baraats, no brides, no beginnings: Inside India's ‘Hamlet of Bachelors’
content: Barwan Kalan, a remote Bihar village, is dubbed the "hamlet of bachelors" as lack of roads, water, and electricity has prevented marriages for over 50 years. Despite being near tourist spots, residents face isolation, with basic services like hospitals and schools miles away.

title: 52-Year-Old Businessman Duped Of Rs 53 Lakh By Woman He Was Going To Marry
content: A 52-year-old city-based businessman was allegedly cheated of Rs 53 lakh by a woman who befriended him through a dating app and induced him to invest in a fraudulent scheme, police said on Thursday.

title: 123-Year-Old Church, Muslim Caretaker: Gulmarg Celebrates White Christmas
content: On Christmas Day, St. Mary's Church stands out in the heart of a snow-covered Gulmarg. As the faithful queue to offer quiet prayers, the church represents the syncretic culture of Kashmir.

title: Bangladesh Unrest Live: Another Hindu Man Beaten To Death In Bangladesh
content: AnotherHindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, days after Dipu Chandra Das was lynched and his body was set ablaze, local media reported on Thursday.

title: Train Fare Hike From Tomorrow. Here's How Much Extra You Will Pay
content: Long-distance train travel is set to get costlier in India from tomorrow after the Indian Railways rolled out a nationwide fare hike that takes effect on Friday.

title: IndiGo Cancels 67 Flights From Multiple Airports Due To Bad Weather
content: Domestic carrier IndiGo on Thursday cancelled 67 flights from multiple airports due to "forecasted" bad weather and operational reasons, according to the airline's website.

title: DK Shivakumar Meets Mallikarjun Kharge Amid Karnataka Power Tussle
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar on Thursday met Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge at his residence here, leading to speculations linking it to the ongoing power tussle in the state for the CM post.

title: 30,000 Worshippers, One Spirit: Inside Delhi's Mega Christmas Celebration
content: Ankit Sajwan Ministries, a prominent church in New Delhi, hosted a Mega Christmas Celebration this week, drawing more than 30,000 worshippers.

title: Another Hindu Man Lynched In Bangladesh, Police Claim Extortion Bid: Report
content: Another Hindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, days after Dipu Chandra Das was lynched and his body was set ablaze, local media reported on Thursday.

title: Case Against Saurabh Bhardwaj, Other AAP Leaders For 'Fainting' Santa Video
content: The Delhi Police on Thursday registered an FIR against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders Saurabh Bhardwaj, Sanjeev Jha, and Adil Ahmed Khan on charges of hurting religious sentiments.

title: "For Muslims, Hindus, Christians": Tarique Rahman's Bangladesh Unity Appeal
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) acting chairman Tarique Rahman today asked the people of his troubled nation to work together for bringing peace and stability.

title: King Charles Leads Royals To Church Ahead Of Christmas Address
content: King Charles III led his family to church on foot Thursday, hours before his annual Christmas Day speech to the United Kingdom and the Commonwealth was expected to focus on the theme of pilgrimage.

title: 30-Year-Old Migrant Worker Lynched After Fight Over Bidi In Odisha
content: A 30-year-old migrant worker from West Bengal was allegedly killed in Odisha's Sambalpur district following an altercation over a bidi, police said on Thursday.

title: Analysis: Shifting Political Ideologies, Discontent In Maharashtra Politics
content: On Wednesday, the mood at the Pune NCP (Sharad Pawar) office was unlike that of the earlier elections. The air of excitement was replaced by uncertainty.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates National Memorial Honouring AB Vajpayee's Legacy In Lucknow
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the Rashtriya Prerna Sthal, a landmark national memorial and complex dedicated to celebrating the life and ideals of Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

title: Thailand Says Vishnu Idol Razed For Security, Not To Hurt Hindu Sentiments
content: After the controversy around Thailand destroying a statue of Lord Vishnu in a disputed border area went rife, the country issued a statement. Thailand asserted that the destruction was linked to security reasons.

title: Rape Survivor Attempts Suicide, Names Madhya Pradesh BJP Leader's Family In Note
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri, a woman who had accused Rajat Sharma, son of BJP leader and Shivpuri Municipal Council President Gayatri Sharma, of rape attempted suicide by consuming sleeping pills and rat poison, police said.

title: Swiggy, Zomato Gig Workers Call For All-India Strike On December 25, 31
content: Delivery and gig workers from major e-commerce, food delivery, and home service platforms, including Swiggy, Zomato, Zepto, Blinkit, Amazon, Flipkart, and other E-Commerce aggregator companies, are observing an all-India strike on December 25 and 31.

title: Sleeping Man Falls From 10th Floor, Avoids Death As Leg Gets Stuck In Grille
content: He was sleeping in his 10th-floor flat and turned, falling straight out of a window to what would have been certain death. Fortunately for him, his leg got stuck in the grille of a flat two floors down.

title: Vajpayee's Media Expert Recalls Ex PM's Peace Efforts And Kargil War
content: Ashok Tandon, the media relations professional who served in former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's office from 1998 to 2004, in an interview with NDTV recalled how Vajpayee managed major challenges with great ease.

title: Distressed By Pet Dog's Prolonged Illness, Two Sisters In UP Die By Suicide
content: What began as an ordinary day in a Lucknow household ended in tragedy after two sisters consumed phenol and died, with police linking the incident to long-term depression and emotional distress over their ailing pet dog.

title: Points league rankings: Michael Porter Jr. vaults into top 20
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . he has moved up into the top-20 in the points rankings . his 25.6 PPG, 7.4 RPG and 3.3 APG would mark career highs for MPJ .

title: Why believe in Tyler Shough, Malik Willis and other unlikely playoff starters?
content: a new year threatens to begin before you've processed the entirety of the one that you're still navigating . the month of December rolled out at an excruciating pace . there are a variety of pocketed countdown calendars replete with surprises like chocolates or crystals .

title: Power Rankings: Kentucky, Seton Hall crack top 25
content: Kentucky dropped out of these Power Rankings back on Dec. 4 . the Wildcats lost by 35 points to Gonzaga in Nashville on tuesday . a complete roster looks very much like a top-25 team, if the second half is any indication .

title: Doncic, Reaves and the hilarious bromance fueling the Lakers' wild start
content: the 8,000-sQUARE-FOOT Manhattan Beach mansion was designed with a minimalist motif . the five-bedroom home was built from tennis star Maria Sharapova . it features a premium man cave amenity that doubles as an irresistible lure for competition junkies .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with each having six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: Bundesliga's best so far: Olise, Díaz stand out in Bayern's dominance this season
content: Harry Kane is the fastest player to reach 100 Bundesliga goal contributions . the keeper is the top-ranked player in the world-class category . he wants and deserves another season in the upcoming season . click here for all the latest bayern munich news .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: What happened to the NBA's Christmas jerseys?
content: a certain tradition has been missing from the holiday season in recent years: Christmas jerseys . the answer is simple: what happened? Nike took over the NBA's uniform contract from Adidas in 2017 . last year, leBron James weighed in on the matter .

title: Hawai'i caps rally with last-minute TD to stun Cal
content: backup quarterback Luke Weaver threw a 22-yard touchdown pass to Nick Cenacle with 10 seconds left . weaver entered the game after Micah Alejado took a hard hit on the previous play . he led his program to its first nine-win season since 2019 .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Micah Alejado helps Hawai'i erase 21-point deficit
content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from bowl season . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . quarterback micah Alejado proved to be the best quarterback on the field Wednesday .

title: 🔎 Inside Penn State's 58-day coaching search
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: the transfer window opens in early January across the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A . but clubs have been busy planning their business for months . arsenal's summer spend was so comprehensive that they now have the best squad depth in England .
